com.samsung.android.sdk.healthdata

Class HealthConnectionErrorResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.healthdata.HealthConnectionErrorResult

  • public final class HealthConnectionErrorResult
extends Object
    This class handles errors raised by connection failure to the health data store.

    The following example shows how to handle the connection error. 

     import android.app.Activity;
 import android.app.AlertDialog;
 import android.content.DialogInterface;
 import android.os.Bundle;
 import android.util.Log;

 import com.samsung.android.sdk.healthdata.*;

 public class MainActivity extends Activity {
     private HealthDataStore mStore;

     @Override
     public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {

         // ...

         HealthDataService healthDataService = new HealthDataService();
         try {
             healthDataService.initialize(this);
         } catch (Exception e) {
             // Handles exceptions
         }
         mStore = new HealthDataStore(this, mConnectionListener);
         mStore.connectService();
     }

     @Override
     public void onDestroy() {
         mStore.disconnectService();
         super.onDestroy();
     }

     private final HealthDataStore.ConnectionListener mConnectionListener = new HealthDataStore.ConnectionListener() {

         @Override
         public void onConnected() {
             // The connection is successful.
         }

         @Override
         public void onConnectionFailed(HealthConnectionErrorResult error) {
             // The connection fails.
             showConnectionFailureDialog(error);
         }

         @Override
         public void onDisconnected() {
             // The connection is disconnected.
         }
     };

     private void showConnectionFailureDialog(HealthConnectionErrorResult error) {

         AlertDialog.Builder alert = new AlertDialog.Builder(this);
         mConnError = error;
         String message = "Connection with S Health is not available";

         if (mConnError.hasResolution()) {
             switch(error.getErrorCode()) {
             case HealthConnectionErrorResult.PLATFORM_NOT_INSTALLED:
                 message = "Please install S Health";
                 break;
             case HealthConnectionErrorResult.OLD_VERSION_PLATFORM:
                 message = "Please upgrade S Health";
                 break;
             case HealthConnectionErrorResult.PLATFORM_DISABLED:
                 message = "Please enable S Health";
                 break;
             case HealthConnectionErrorResult.USER_AGREEMENT_NEEDED:
                 message = "Please agree with S Health policy";
                 break;
             default:
                 message = "Please make S Health available";
                 break;
             }
         }

         alert.setMessage(message);

         alert.setPositiveButton("OK", new DialogInterface.OnClickListener() {
             @Override
             public void onClick(DialogInterface dialog, int id) {
                 if (mConnError.hasResolution()) {
                     mConnError.resolve(mInstance);
                 }
             }
         });

         if (error.hasResolution()) {
             alert.setNegativeButton("Cancel", null);
         }

         alert.show();
     }
 }

    See Also:
    HealthDataStore.ConnectionListener.onConnectionFailed(HealthConnectionErrorResult)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE
      The connection is not established in the Health data framework.
      static int OLD_VERSION_PLATFORM
      The version of the Health data framework is outdated to cooperate with SDK.
      static int OLD_VERSION_SDK
      The library version of Samsung Digital Health is outdated to cooperate with the Health data framework.
      static int PLATFORM_DISABLED
      The Health data framework is disabled.
      static int PLATFORM_NOT_INSTALLED
      The Health data framework is not installed.
      static int PLATFORM_SIGNATURE_FAILURE
      It fails to check the signature of the Health data framework.
      static int TIMEOUT
      The time to have a connection is exceeded the limit.
      static int UNKNOWN
      Unknown error.
      static int USER_AGREEMENT_NEEDED
      User did not agree to terms and condition, and privacy policy of S Health yet.
      static int USER_PASSWORD_NEEDED
      The proper password is not entered.

    • Field Detail

      • UNKNOWN

        public static final int UNKNOWN
        Unknown error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_FAILURE

        public static final int CONNECTION_FAILURE
        The connection is not established in the Health data framework.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLATFORM_NOT_INSTALLED

        public static final int PLATFORM_NOT_INSTALLED
        The Health data framework is not installed. To resolve it, create an activity to install S Health in the application seller site.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OLD_VERSION_SDK

        public static final int OLD_VERSION_SDK
        The library version of Samsung Digital Health is outdated to cooperate with the Health data framework. To resolve it, create an activity to download the latest application which uses the latest library of Samsung Digital Health.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OLD_VERSION_PLATFORM

        public static final int OLD_VERSION_PLATFORM
        The version of the Health data framework is outdated to cooperate with SDK. To resolve it, create an activity to update S Health in the application seller site.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TIMEOUT

        public static final int TIMEOUT
        The time to have a connection is exceeded the limit.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLATFORM_DISABLED

        public static final int PLATFORM_DISABLED
        The Health data framework is disabled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_PASSWORD_NEEDED

        public static final int USER_PASSWORD_NEEDED
        The proper password is not entered.
        Some Samsung devices can request a password to protect user's data. The password for access of health data can be registered in S Health by user and a pop-up to enter the password is shown if it's required by the system. This error occurs when user doesn't input the correct password and an application cannot go on without the password.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLATFORM_SIGNATURE_FAILURE

        public static final int PLATFORM_SIGNATURE_FAILURE
        It fails to check the signature of the Health data framework.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_AGREEMENT_NEEDED

        public static final int USER_AGREEMENT_NEEDED
        User did not agree to terms and condition, and privacy policy of S Health yet. The health data framework is not activated before agreement.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorCode

        public int getErrorCode()
        Gets the error code of connection failure. Usually it is called in HealthDataStore.ConnectionListener.onConnectionFailed(HealthConnectionErrorResult). It's required to resolve the error depending on its returned error code.
        Returns:
        The error code

      • hasResolution

        public boolean hasResolution()
        Checks whether the error has a resolution. If it returns true, you can solve the error by calling resolve(Activity) with an activity. Or handle the error with your implemented activity.
        Returns:
        true if the platform provides a resolution for the error,
        else false

      • resolve

        public void resolve(Activity activity)
        Resolves an error with an activity which is able to get the user's feedback for possible error cases.

        It handles the following errors and operations. Show a proper message for each error case in your application before call this method.

          Error Operation
          PLATFORM_NOT_INSTALLED Linked to the application installation page
          OLD_VERSION_PLATFORM Linked to the application installation page
          PLATFORM_DISABLED Linked to Settings of the device to turn on S Health
          USER_AGREEMENT_NEEDED Linked to the starting screen of S Health to get user's agreement

        Parameters:
        activity - An activity which resolves the error with the user's feedback. Usually the main activity of your application.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the specified input is null or invalid
